alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 18 at 4:16PM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Total snow accumulations 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...Until midnight AKDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow is expected toward the mountains and around Kachemak Bay. Blowing snow will be the main threat from along the Sterling Highway from Kenai southward to Homer where accumulations will be lower.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
